result.rationale: This species is a KwaZulu-Natal endemic described in 2009 from Ndumo Game reserve. Presently it is known from four protected areas. It has four locations, with an extent of occurrence of 13,368 km<sup>2 </sup>and a minimum area of occupancy of 16 km<sup>2</sup>, however the latter is likely to be an underestimate and the true value is uncertain. There is ongoing loss of habitat outside of protected areas to subsistence crop cultivation, rural housing development and cattle overgrazing. This species therefore, at this time, qualifies as Vulnerable under criterion B1ab(ii,iii).
result.geographicrange: This species is endemic to KwaZulu-Natal province, South Africa.
result.population: There is currently no population information available.
result.habitat: This is a ground-dwelling species found in leaf litter and low-growing vegetation, and also collected from beneath rocks and logs where it is well camouflaged against the substrate in the Savanna Biome.
result.threats: It has been impacted by habitat loss to subsistence crop cultivation, rural development and overgrazing by livestock.
result.conservationmeasures: This species has been recorded in four protected areas in South Africa, and they include Ithala Nature Reserve Ntshodwe Camp, Ithala Nature Reserve Doornkraal Camp, Ndumo Game Reserve and Ophathe Game Reserve.
